result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael H Brumm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver (Schedule I, II or III) Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Distribution to Minors], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund Packets
Mailed Restitution Notice to Victim.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  PSI reviewed.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 30 MONTHS probation with the mental health unit.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 5 MONTHS condition time with Huber & Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 12/26/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if physician approved.
- No contact with the victim named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,604.66 payable to Alex K; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form
Letters in Support of the Defendant
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court Orders PSI report to be completed by the mental health unit and NO recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 8/14/2015 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Case recalled. Attorney Cherella in court with defendant. Attorney Patricia Daugherty for the State. Continued discussions of possibility of eligibility to DTC placed on the record. State still does not object to the defense requests. Court granted defense requests to vacate the Jury Trial and to set a Status Conference date. Jury Trial date on 6/24/2015 vacated. Case adjourned to branch 15.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for attorney Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests the Jury Trial date be vacated and requests a Status Conference. State does not object.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court cancelled stayed bench warrant.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defendant is the hospital.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   
Arraignment held.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

As an additional condition of bail:
No illegal drugs
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Branch 15.

Defendant Michael H Brumm in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
